title: Airline pilots: industry wide FRE for 2013/14 onwards: summary

details.body:
Under the terms of the agreement between HMRC and BALPA, uniformed pilots, co-pilots and other uniformed flight deck crew may obtain the following expenses deductions for 2013/14 onwards (for details of the FRE applicable from 2006/07 to 2012/13 please see [EIM50050](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM50050)):
A FRE deduction of £1022 per year (reduced, if necessary, for employer contributions - see [EIM50059](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM50059)) **or** their actual, vouched expenses in respect of allowable items in that year (see [EIM50052](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM50052))
**plus**
If the employer requires pilots to wear a uniform, but does not provide one, the cost of replacing items of uniform (see [EIM50053](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM50053) and [EIM32475](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM32475))
**plus**
If the employer does not provide a noise-cancelling headset, capital allowances for the cost of a noise-cancelling headset (see [EIM50054](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM50054))
**plus**
A further expenses deduction (EXP) of £110 per year for travel to certain specified events **or** the actual, allowable expenses of travel to those events (see [EIM50060](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM50060))
**plus**
The actual, allowable expenses of travelling to other temporary workplaces in the year (see [EIM50060](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM50060))
See also [EIM50045](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM50045) (BALPA subscriptions), [EIM50055](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM50055) (luggage) and [EIM50056](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM50056) (computers).
